name: QUALITY_CONTROL
label: Quality control
definition: A quality control testing study design type is where some aspect of the experiment is quality controlled for the purposes of quality assurance.

name: BIRTH_COHORT
label: Birth cohort
definition: A cohort study for which the subjects are followed from the time of birth usually including information about gestation and follow up.

name: POPULATION_BASED
label: Population-based
definition: Study done at the population level or among the population groups

name: DISEASE_SPECIFIC
label: Disease specific
definition: A study or biobank for which material and information is collected from subjects that have already developed a particular disease.

name: CASE_CONTROL
label: Case-Control
definition: A case-control study design compares two groups of subjects: those with the disease or condition under study (cases) and a very similar group of subjects who do not have the disease or condition (controls).

name: RD
label: Rare disease collection
definition: A collection that is focusing on rare diseases

name: HOSPITAL
label: Hospital
definition: A collection that contains patients from a hospital

name: CROSS_SECTIONAL
label: Cross-sectional
definition: A type of observational study that involves data collection from a population

name: COHORT
label: Cohort
definition: A form of longitudinal study for the analysis of risk factors following a group of people who do not have a disease

name: TWIN_STUDY
label: Twin-study
definition: Twin studies measure the contribution of genetics (as opposed to environment) to a given trait or condition of interest.

name: LONGITUDINAL
label: Longitudinal
definition: Research studies involving repeated observations of the same entity over time. In the biobank context
